text:
|1| That which was from the beginning,
which we have heard,
which we have seen with our eyes,
which we looked upon and have touched with our hands,
concerning the word of life—
|2| the life was made manifest,
and we have seen it,
and testify to it and proclaim to you the eternal life,
which was with the Father and was made manifest to us—
|3| that which we have seen and heard we proclaim also to you,
so that you too may have fellowship with us;
and indeed our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.
|4| And we are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.

nouns: that which was from the beginning

Author: heard that which was from the beginning
had seen with their own eyes that which was from the beginning
had looked upon and touched that which was from the beginning
had seen the word of life
testified to the word of life
proclaimed to the audience the eternal life
had the eternal life that was with the Father manifested to them
proclaimed to the audience what they had seen and heard
wanted to have fellowship with the audience
had fellowship with the Father and with Jesus
wrote the letter so that their joy may be complete
Audience: heard te testimony of the author
were proclaimed to regarding eternal life
had the option of fellowship with the author, with the Father, with the Son
God: is the word of life made manifest
eternal life was with the Father
the word of life was manifested to the author
has fellowship with the author, and is available to the audience

points: The author encountered the word of life in fellowship and in tangible ways
The author testified and proclaimed the things seen, heard and touched
The author desired to have fellowship with the audience, the Father and the Son
The author wrote about the word of life so that the author's joy would be complete

expound.one: the life was made manifest, and we have seen it
expound.two: That life that started it all, that life that holds it all together is that life which came to earth, lived and breathed and healed and bled
expound.three: Oh life, you are no distant star, no faint glimmer, you are near, you are as close as the joy I feel, as effective as a pleasing breeze or searing flame. You are not all mystery and shroud, you are voice and song, food and satisfaction.
expound.four: In the vast cold of scornful earth, Thy power has emerged a calming voice. In the dark emptiness of a despairing soul, Thy life has flooded warming light. In the bitter tense untrusting church, Thy sacrifice crucifies all arrogant aim.

adoration: What is something that Jesus did on earth that you find particularly impressive?
confession: In what situations are you most distant from fellowship with God?
